page.title: 15THE TWO LIFEBOATS.
page.content: The first Sheringham Lifeboats were locally provided and one of these "The Henry Ramey Upcher" is still on view in its boat-shed on the front. The present lifeboat was built in 1961 and its name is the "Manchester Unity of Oddfellows". It was provided by funds donated to the Royal National Lifeboat Institution (R.N.L.I.). TYPE * {37ft. Oakley BUILT * {Osbourne Ltd. LENGTH * {37 feet BEAM * {11ft. 6ins. DISPLACEMENT * {11 tons 19 cwts. CREW * {7 ENGINE * {Twin Perkins {Diesel FULL SPEED * {8 knots RANGE OF ACTION * {70 miles The boat is equipped with radar and cost Â£28,500. The crew have won 1 silver and 2 bronze medals.
